```{r setup, include=FALSE}
knitr::opts_chunk$set(echo = TRUE)
```

Load packages we need.

```{r "load packages"}
library("tidyverse")
library("here")
```


Read in the chocolate data, then explore it.

```{r "read in data"}
chocolate <- readRDS(here("data", "chocolate.RDS"))
glimpse(chocolate)
```

Now we can make a histogram using base R graphics. You'll likely want to check <https://r-graphics.org/recipe-quick-histogram> for more information on how to make histograms with `ggplot2`.

```{r}
hist(chocolate$rating)
```
